item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, November 29, 2024 at 12:30 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Send someone you appreciate an official 'Continue and Persist' Letter (927 points | 161 comments)
2. Engineers do not get to make startup mistakes when they build ledgers (212 points | 212 comments)
3. The UX of Lego Interface Panels (2020) (388 points | 39 comments)
4. Borgo Programming Language (68 points | 14 comments)
5. Show HN: Screen Sharing in the Browser (116 points | 22 comments)
6. Show HN: Vince – A self hosted alternative to Google Analytics (94 points | 26 comments)
7. The success and failure of Ninja (2020) (214 points | 47 comments)
8. The trouble with struct sockaddr's fake flexible array (51 points | 10 comments)
9. Using Pandoc and Typst to Produce PDFs (41 points | 9 comments)
10. A pretty visualisation of the European power grid (2022) (268 points | 140 comments)
11. Mirror, Mirror on the Wall, What Is the Best Topology of Them All? (14 points | discuss)
12. Institutional memory and reverse smuggling (5 points | discuss)
13. William James and the philosophy of pragmatism (2018) (66 points | 15 comments)
14. Rapid colonization of a space-returned Ryugu sample by terrestrial microorganism (93 points | 38 comments)
15. Multimodal Interpretability in 2024 (20 points | discuss)
16. Bootkitty: Analyzing the first UEFI bootkit for Linux (137 points | 68 comments)
17. Show HN: Indentation-based syntax for Clojure (45 points | 16 comments)
18. A new start after 60: I became a 'hummingbird' for people with dementia (123 points | 27 comments)
19. 'PDF to Brainrot' study tools are an iteration on a TikTok trend (30 points | 28 comments)
20. Float Self-Tagging (58 points | 43 comments)
21. This G15 is the Oldest Running Digital Computer in America [video] (49 points | 6 comments)
22. Mechanical Engineer creates instruments for his one man industrial metal band (40 points | 13 comments)
23. Gimp 3.0 – a milestone for open-source image editing (94 points | 33 comments)
24. The great abandonment: what happens to the natural world when people disappear? (82 points | 84 comments)
25. Hetzner cuts traffic on US VPSs, raises prices (355 points | 592 comments)
26. Spotify has shut down several API endpoints (214 points | 186 comments)
27. The Surprisingly Sunny Origins of the Frankfurt School (13 points | 11 comments)
28. In the Rockets' Red Glare: The past and future of hot-rodding in America (51 points | 48 comments)
29. Show HN: Myphotos.site – Make a gallery website from Google Photos (167 points | 75 comments)
30. An Intuitive Explanation of Sparse Autoencoders for LLM Interpretability (45 points | discuss)
